title: How powerful is a sun-dipped Superman? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on how sun-dipped Superman is. I’ll give examples on a scale of sorts for a sun-dipped Superman, and feats to go along with them. I won’t give a definitive ranking of these feats, I’ll just leave it at them being very impressive.  1). Barely Sun-Dipped This is a Superman after only spending a little time at/near the sun. My example will be a feat of Superman’s from Superman/Batman #13, where he cracks the Source Wall:   This Superman is barely sun-amped, and arguably just base Superman. I put this as a sun-dipped Superman because he blitzed Darkseid to the sun beforehand:  Note: Superman did have a motherbox, but it’s unknown how it really affected him. 2). Sun-Dipped I’ll be using the Sun-Dipped Superman from Our Worlds at War, and specifically Action Comics #782. I haven’t read Our Worlds at War in a while, so I’m blurry on the details. I think there might’ve been something with Kismet, but I just don’t remember. I’ll have to reread OWAW. Either way, this Superman pushed Warlord, which was powered by the Big Bang:  This scan is more debatable whether or not it happened, so I’ll just say Superman possibly survived a Big Bang:   Also, one detail to note, apparently this Big Bang would be affecting 11–13 dimensions, so if Superman did really survive it, it could be a Multi-Universal feat:  3). Massively Sun-Dipped Incredibly famous example, as well as an obvious one, the Sun-Dipped Superman from Justice League #25. This Superman did damage to the World Forger and even destroyed his Masterpiece:     I’ve seen many try to debunk the feat based on out of context author quotes (where they admit to be confused later) and whatnot, but it’s pretty legit to me. Of course, Superman’s power is massively amplified. He flew through multiple stars on his way to punch the Forger. It is true that Forger was off-guard, but even knocking down an off-guard Forger is an impressive feat. So, these are my sun-dipped Superman feats. I could bring up more, but 3 are enough. Whether you think Sun-Dipped Superman is a Planet Buster, Multiverse Buster or whatever, I think we can at least agree that this version of Superman is extremely powerful.

As powerful as he needs to be. Sun dipping grants Superman a power boost by increasing the amount of solar energy he’s absorbed. Superman has no maximum limit to the amount of energy he can absorb, and therefore he can sundip for as long as he needs in order to defeat his opponent.
